ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
1 = left experience chosen; 2 = right experience chosen

ElementDescription: Left choice text (option displayed on left side of screen (25 of these are the social option, remaining 25 are the nonsocial option))
Right choice text (option displayed on right side of screen (25 of these are the social option, remaining 25 are the nonsocial option))
Monetary value for left choice (price point of option on left)
Monetary value for right choice (price point of option on right)
Indicates whether the social option was on the left or right
Notes: 0= social option is displayed on right; 1= social option is displayed on the left
computed average of spent amount on chosen social expereinces
computed average of spent amount on chosen non-social expereinces
sum of amount spent on social experiences
sum of amount spent on non-social experiences
percentage of time social experience was chosen
percentage of time non-social experience was chosen

ElementDescription: Total number of social expereiences chosen
Median of monetary bids of 60 snacks
Amount of times participants chose snack during the 60 trials
Amount of times participants chose cost during the 60 trials
